column4: Great! GParted is warning me that it is "Unable to read the contents of this file system!" (The drive I just formated.)
have you actually made file system there or just created a partition?
I'm getting that error on the first partition, not the second. (sda1)
- sda2 is showing that it has files on it. I set it as my primary partition. Maybe I shouldn't have done that. sda1 is showing empy, with an error saying that it can't be read.
- I'm not running fdisk. Can I do that from within gParted?
no idea. are you using ubuntu live or what?
I'm running GParted distribution right now, just for formating and partitioning
sorry, no idea about gparted capabilities. from my experience though, after creating partitions you have to plant file system there, though gparted could automate it, however.
btw, wouldn't it be better to run ubuntu live instead of gparted? i mean - i believe ubuntu live has gparted and so much more. is there any reason to use gparted's own? (just asking)

I'm going to need to create in install USB, but all I have is a version of ubuntu that is old, or x86 (my pc is x64). SO I'm going to have to create an bootable USB of a version of Ubuntu I don't have. So I'll have to download it. Does usb-creator-gtk let me do that?
you'll have to download iso yourself, once you have the image just point the program to it
-- thanks for the help. JK_ you too.
